intro: Roodebergia, commonly known as the "red mountain" plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Roodebergia species are often found growing in open grasslands and on rocky outcrops, where they contribute to the biodiversity of these ecosystems. Due to their adaptability and aesthetic appeal, some species are cultivated in gardens as ornamental plants.
